about_the_game:
There's a strange town on the outskirts.
They say that something beyond belief happens there.
They say that almost every person that goes there does not return.
They say that the few ones who manage to return never speak about what they saw.
They also say that an entity from another world hides in the sewers, but that's irrelevant to this story.
They say the sort of things that make you too curious about unknown dangers even when the rational part of your brain tells you not to. In several languages. With a megaphone.
The town they speak about is in front of you. Will you live to tell the tale?
Wait, wait, wait, weren’t we here before?



Badcome back.
Until it’s Undone, the anti-point-and-click in which you unmake puzzles by typing, has returned, weirder than ever. It’s a short ride, but one that will stick with you like a limpet made of wonder and confusion.
  • Complete graphic overhaul with sprites created from home-taken pictures, plus a few stock images and doodles.
  • New minigame sections centered around twisting popular game mechanics into something almost unrecognizable.
  • Expanded soundtrack.
  • A few alternative puzzle solutions.
  • Plenty of optimizations.
  • 85% more body horror.
  • Even more sarcasm.
  • A giant spider (kinda).

It’s time to go back to the lost town, one last time.

linux_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: 20
  • Processor: Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-4790 CPU @ 3.60GHz 3.60 GHz
  • Memory: 1 GB RAM
  • Graphics: AMD Radeon R7 200 series
  • Storage: 1 GB available space
  • Sound Card: realtek high definition audio

name: Until It’s Undone: Unmastered

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: 10
  • Processor: Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-4790 CPU @ 3.60GHz 3.60 GHz
  • Memory: 1 GB RAM
  • Graphics: AMD Radeon R7 200 series
  • Storage: 1 GB available space
  • Sound Card: realtek high definition audio

short_description: A forgotten oldie returns with a full makeover. Control some lost idiot by typing commands. Unmake puzzles to progress. Bump into several lovely weirdos along the way. Discover a wonderland of disturbing nonsense and industrial amounts of sarcasm.
